name: contended
content:
Add to word list

past simple and past participle of
contend
contend verb
(COMPETE)
[ I ] to compete in order to win something: There are three world-class tennis players contending for this title. He's contending against someone with twice his experience.

contend verb
(CLAIM)
[ T + (that) ] formal to say that something is true or is a fact: The lawyer contended (that) her client had never been near the scene of the crime.
